intro: Popowia alata, commonly known as the winged popowia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
